Uses of Interface
net.uniform.api.Form

  • Packages that use Form 
    Package Description
    net.uniform.api  
    net.uniform.html  
    net.uniform.html.decorators  
    net.uniform.html.formvalidators  
    net.uniform.impl  

    • Uses of Form in net.uniform.api

      Methods in net.uniform.api that return Form 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Form Form.addDefaultDecoratorForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz, Decorator decorator)
      Adds a default decorator for the given element class, to be used when adding elements to the form without any decorators.
      Form Form.addElement(Element element)
      Adds an element to the form.
      Form Form.addElement(Element element, boolean useDefaultDecorators)
      Adds an element to the form.
      Form Form.addElements(boolean useDefaultDecorators, Element... elements)
      Adds several elements doing the same as addElement(net.uniform.api.Element, boolean) method.
      Form Form.addElements(Element... elements)
      Adds several elements doing the same as addElement(net.uniform.api.Element) method.
      Form Form.addValidator(FormValidator validator)
      Adds a form validator to the form.
      Form Form.clearValidation()
      Sets the validation performed status of this form and all its elements to false.
      Form Form.clearValidators()
      Removes all validators from this form.
      Form Form.endDecorator()
      Ends the current open decorator.
      Form Form.getFormDataIntoBean(Object bean)
      Does the same as getFormDataConvertedToElementValueTypes() but automatically sets any matching bean property to the given object, by looking at the each property name and type class.
      Form Form.populate(Map<String,List<String>> formData)
      Clears data and validation status (like reset()) from all elements in the form and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form Form.populate(Map<String,List<String>> formData, boolean keepOtherValues)
      Clears data and validation status (like reset()) from all elements in the form only if keepOtherValues is false, and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form Form.populateBean(Object bean)
      Does the same as populateSimple(java.util.Map) but automatically extracting all accessible bean properties from the given object.
      Form Form.populateBean(Object bean, boolean keepOtherValues)
      Does the same as populateSimple(java.util.Map, boolean) but automatically extracting all accessible bean properties from the given object.
      Form Form.populateSimple(Map<String,?> formData)
      Clears data and validation status (like reset()) from all elements in the form and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form Form.populateSimple(Map<String,?> formData, boolean keepOtherValues)
      Clears data and validation status (like reset()) from all elements in the form only if keepOtherValues is false, and populates them by name calling their populate method.
      Form Form.removeDecorator(String id)
      Removes a decorator from the form by id, if existing.
      Form Form.removeDefaultDecoratorsForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      Removes any specific default decorators configuration for the given element class in this form, if existing.
      Form Form.removeDefaultRendererForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz)
      Removes any specific default render configuration for the given element class in this form, if existing.
      Form Form.removeElement(Element element)
      Removes an element from the form.
      Form Form.removeElement(String id)
      Removes an element from the form by id.
      Form Form.removeProperty(String key)
      Removes a property from this form, if existing.
      Form Form.removeValidator(FormValidator validator)
      Removes a validator from this form.
      Form Form.reset()
      Resets the values and validation status of the form an all its elements.
      Form Form.setAutoEnableElementsTranslation(boolean autoEnableElementsTranslation)
      Sets or unsets the auto enabling of elements translation when adding them to the form.
      Form Form.setDefaultDecoratorsForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz, List<Decorator> decorators)
      Replaces the default decorators list for the given element class, to be used when adding elements to the form without any decorators.
      Form Form.setDefaultRendererForElementClass(Class<? extends Element> clazz, Renderer renderer)
      Sets a default renderer for the given element class, to be used when adding elements to the form without a renderer.
      Form Form.setElementValue(String elementId, List<String> value)
      Sets the multi-string value of an element by id.
      Form Form.setElementValue(String elementId, Object value)
      Sets the value of an element by id doing the same as populateSimple(java.util.Map), by converting the object to a list of Strings or a single String.
      Form Form.setElementValue(String elementId, String value)
      Sets the single-string value of an element by id.
      Form Form.setProperty(String key, String value)
      Sets the value of a property in this form.
      Form Form.setValidators(List<FormValidator> validators)
      Replaces the list of validators in this form.
      Form Form.startDecorator(String id, Decorator decorator)
      Starts a form decorator that will be applied to any HTML tags produced between this and the corresponding call to endDecorator() method.
      Methods in net.uniform.api with parameters of type Form 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<String> FormValidator.getValidationErrors(Form form, Map<String,List<String>> formData)
      Returns the validation errors for the form, if any.
      List<SimpleHTMLTag> Element.render(Form form)
      Renders the list of HTML tags of this element, using the set render or the default renderer if the set renderer is null.
      List<SimpleHTMLTag> Decorator.render(Form form, List<Element> elements, List<SimpleHTMLTag> rendered)
      Decorate the previously generated HTML.
